Logger Decorators

The logger class provides decorators to log the start, end, or exceptions of functions. You can use these decorators to automatically log function activities.

Function Start Decorator

The dorsa_logger.logger.function_start_decorator() decorator is used to log a message at the start of a function. It takes the log message (either a predefined message key or a custom log message) as an argument. If no message provided, it use a fixed defined message for logging. The decorator creates a new log with the specified message at the beginning of the function execution.

You can use this decorator before defining your function with the @ symbol:

@logger_obj.function_start_decorator()
def func(a, b):
    # Function logic goes here

You can also pass your own log message to it:

@logger_obj.function_start_decorator(dorsa_logger.log_message(level=dorsa_logger.log_levels.INFO, message="Function started.", code="ERR000"))
def func(a, b):
    # Function logic goes here

Function Exception Decorators

The dorsa_logger.logger.function_exception_decorator() is used to log a message when an exception occurs within a function. It takes the log message (either a predefined message key or a custom log message) as an argument. If no message provided, it use a fixed defined message for logging. The decorator also provides an option to handle the exception and continue with the program execution or re-raise the exception to propagate it further. When applied to a function, it creates a new log entry with the specified message if an exception occurs within the function.

You can use this decorator before defining your function with the @ symbol:

@logger_obj.function_exception_decorator()
def func(a, b):
    # Function logic goes here

You can also pass your own log message to it:

@logger_obj.function_exception_decorator(dorsa_logger.log_message(level=dorsa_logger.log_levels.EXCEPTION, message="An exception occurred.", code="ERR002"), with_handling=True)
def func(a, b):
    # Function logic goes here

Function End Decorator

The dorsa_logger.logger.function_end_decorator() decorator is used to log a message at the end of a function. It takes the log message (either a predefined message key or a custom log message) as an argument. If no message provided, it use a fixed defined message for logging. The decorator creates a new log entry with the specified message just after the function finishes executing.

You can use this decorator before defining your function with the @ symbol:

@logger_obj.function_end_decorator()
def func(a, b):
    # Function logic goes here

You can also pass your own log message to it:

@logger_obj.function_end_decorator(dorsa_logger.log_message(level=dorsa_logger.log_levels.INFO, message="Function finished.", code="ERR001"))
def func(a, b):
    # Function logic goes here
